channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: There is a simple fix for America’s job-quality crisis: actually give workers a piece of the business
item.description: My dad spent 40 years operating heavy machinery. He was proud of his work but he didn’t feel respected. Today, I see those same tensions are still wit...

item.title: The low-hire, low-fire economy crawls along with job openings unchanged from September to October
item.description: Job openings have come down steadily since peaking at a record 12.1 million in March 2022. They were 7.7 million for both of the last two months.

item.title: When David Ellison was 13, his billionaire father Larry bought him a plane. He competed in air shows before leaving it to become a Hollywood executive
item.description: Ellison, 42, revived “Top Gun”—and now he’s taking the fight to Netflix.

item.title: Economic calendar: Investors to weigh job-openings data as Fed convenes
Latest data show U.S. job openings rebounding — but not hiring
Mortgage rates are surging ahead of the Fed’s expected rate cut. What gives?
Tech is on a debt-fueled AI spending spree with Oracle as canary in coal mine
Netflix CEO brushes aside Paramount’s ‘entirely expected’ hostile bid, ‘superconfident’ of closing deal with Warner Bros. Discovery
item.description: The Netflix co-CEO also said he’s talked with the president “many times” since the election, and that he’ll be good to movie theaters once he’s runnin...

item.title: Nvidia’s stock rises as Trump blesses China sales. It's a big opportunity.
Deutsche Bank and Jeffrey Epstein’s ghost
item.description: Given its long history of servicing high-risk clients, it is perhaps unsurprising that Deutsche Bank stepped in when Epstein was ditched by JPMorgan.
